intro: Ateleia sousae, commonly known as the African wild pear, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native habitat, though it is not widely cultivated.
